question_text: An oil drop of radius 2 mm with a density 3 g cm^-3 is held stationary under a constant electric field 3.55 x 10^5 V/m in the Millikan's oil drop experiment. What is the number of excess electrons that the oil drop will possess? (Consider g = 9.81 m/s^2)

Match List-I with List-II. List-I: (a) rms speed of gas molecules (b) Pressure exerted by ideal gas (c) Average kinetic energy of a molecule (d) Total internal energy of 1 mole of a diatomic gas. List-II: (i) (1/3) nm v_rms^2 (ii) (3/2) kT (iii) (5/2) RT (iv) sqrt(3RT/M).

A constant magnetic field of 1 Tesla is applied in the x > 0 region. A metallic circular ring of radius 1 m is moving with a constant velocity of 1 m/s along the x-axis. At t = 0 s, the centre of the ring is at x = -1 m. What will be the value of the induced emf in the ring at t = 1 s? (Assume the velocity is towards positive x-axis).

The time period of a simple pendulum is given by T = 2π √(L/g). The measured value of the length of the pendulum is 10 cm known to 1 mm accuracy. The time for 200 oscillations of the pendulum is found to be 100 seconds using a clock of 1s resolution. The percentage accuracy in the determination of g using this pendulum is 'x'. The value of 'x' to the nearest integer is:
A particle of mass m moves in a circular orbit under the central potential field U(r) = -C/r, where C is a positive constant. The correct radius - velocity graph of the particle's motion is:

options.Option 1: A curve where v increases as r increases
options.Option 2: A straight line parallel to r-axis
options.Option 3: A curve where v decreases as r increases (Rectangular Hyperbola type)
options.Option 4: A straight line passing through origin

Match List-I with List-II. List-I: (a) 2 SO2(g) + O2(g) -> 2 SO3(g) (b) 4 NH3(g) + 5 O2(g) -> 4 NO(g) + 6 H2O(g) (c) N2(g) + 3 H2(g) -> 2 NH3(g) (d) Vegetable oil + H2 -> Vegetable Ghee. List-II (Catalyst): (i) Pt(s) (ii) V2O5 (iii) Fe(s) (iv) Ni(s).

options.Option 1: A = Benzene diazonium chloride, B = Fluorobenzene
options.Option 3: A = Benzene diazonium chloride, B = Benzene
